reviewText: This DVD has it all.  Andre Rieu is a wonderful showman, a great violinist, and a fantastic conductor.  This performance combines wonderful music and great fun.  It's so obvious the audience and the orchestra members are all having a grand time. The dialogue is in Dutch so is sub-titled but that is not a distraction. The music will have you swaying with the crowd and the sequence with the carollineur is priceless!  We have already watched this performance twice and will watch it again soon.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own several Rieu DVD's. They are all very good. This one however, is the very best so far. It is very entertaining; lots of very happy music. The 3 tenors (Die Platin-Tenore) and Benny Neyman are fantastic! They should be named on the DVD packaging.

reviewText: Last night, Alessandra Prado, Carmen Bradley, Lina Navarini, Alexander J. Ariano and I had the opportunity to see Andre Rieu, LIVE, at the Bank Atlantic Center, in Sunrise, Florida, which he kept up calling Fort Lauderdale.As he enters the room, the sounds of his violin capture our spirits and we knew we were in for a delightful experience. All orchestra members dressed to replicate the times when the Waltz was at its best, to share the magic of Vienna with fans, and to provide us with sheer enchantment through his music.This is the second time we choose to see him in South Florida and something tells me that we shall continue to go to his concerts for as we watch him we fall under the spell of a man, who seems to love what he does so much, that as we watch we are filled with joy, as he conducts and plays some of the best music ever written.So, we bought The Homecoming and watch it regularly, all I have to do is close my eyes and I see him on stage, his broad smile worn as a badge of courage to live life to its fullest, the twinkle in his eye making us wonder what to do to make sure we live our lives in such a way that we too learn to share the best of ourselves with humanity.This DVD will provide you with some of his most delightful performances, amongst which are my favorites: Carmen... Funiculi, Funicula... and I Could Have Danced All Night!This is an open air concert, delivered Maastricht, which is Andre Rieu's home town. As with most of his concerts, the atmosphere is filled with joy and beautiful music. We get to witness his electrifying performance encouraging the townspeople to dance and sing.Sincerely recommend obtaining this classic and take the time to thank my good fortune to be alive during the times when Andre Rieu is with us, for I have enjoyed his music tremendously. As a child I read the story and own the books and the DVDs that capture the lives of the Emperor of Austria, Franz Josef as he meets, falls in love with, and then marries the Austrian princess Sissi.This couple lived during the times of Johan Strauss, and Sissi inspires many of the wonderful waltzes played by Andre Rieu. So, to see him live and realize that he even brought someone out to sing as if she was Sissi, dressed in the fashion that made her beauty so famous, with flower adorned hair... was... a dream come true!Therefore, our group has decided to follow Andre Reiu's recommendations and we are planning to travel to Vienna 2008... to enjoy his music, right by the famous castle where Sissi and Franz Josef lived the most romantic of all lives... transformed and shared with the world as a story, book, and movie!!! Austria... thanks to Andre Rieu... we shall visit in 2008!
summary: Andre Rieu provides sheer enchantment through music

reviewText: This guy is a class act. Coming from R&R; concerts I hesitated on this one. I mean, being a big Rush and Rolling Stones fan, this venture is very different. Where us rockers stand around with cool t-shirts and drink beer out of plastic cups, Andre Rieu fans ooze class. Class that Europeans have over us casual AmeriKans.Audio and video are top-notch. I watched the whole 2 hours and 47 minutes in one evening - that's a very good sign. This show young and old will love no matter what their musical tastes. I give it five flaming chilies.

reviewText: Well, Finally it arrives in US. The most beautiful and one of the MUST MUST HAVE DVD of Andre Rieu and his Johann Strauss Orchestra. This is the same DVD called SONGS FROM MY HEART (European Release of 2005) with a new US marketing name The HOMECOMING. Concert has 28 tracks in 2 parts, and they are:Part 11.Carmen - Ouverture2.Fliegermarsch/Aviator's March3.Du bist mit Gold nicht zu bezahlen/You're worth your weight in gold4.Vilja Lied/Vilja Song (by Carmen)5.Heut' ist der schönste Tag (by The Platin Tenors)6.Ach ich hab' in meinem Herzen (by The Platin Tenors)7.Concierto de Aranjuez (church bells played by Frank)8.Es läuten die Glocken von Limburg/Swinging bells of Limburg9.Funiculi, Funicula10.Im weißen Rössl/The White Horse Inn (The Platin Tenors and Carmen, Carla, Susan)11.Second Waltz12.Chiantilied/Chianti Song13.Maastrichter Hymne/Maastricht Anthem (Carmen, Carla, Susan)Part 214.Radetzky March15.Ob blond, ob braun (The Platin Tenors)16.I Could Have Danced All Night (Carmen, Carla, Susan)17.With A Little Bit Of Luck (Carmen, Carla, Susan)18.Die Juliska aus Budapest/Juliska from Budapest (Carla)19.Memory (Susan)20.Als flotter Geist/A Bright Young Man/Strauss Medley21.Toselli Serenade22.Libiamo (The Platin Tenors and Carmen, Carla, Susan)23.La donna e mobile24.Auld lang syne25.Ode an Maastricht (song by a local singer)26.Guten Abend gut' Nacht/Lullaby27.Einzugsmarsch/Entry March28.Maastricht, Stadt der fröhlichen Sänger/Maastricht,City of Jolly SingersIt is an open air concert in Andre Rieu's home town (in summer of 2005) in Maastricht (NL) and has wonderful song selections from waltzes to classical pieces, from Broadway to polkas. With great atmosphere of concert, it returns to an open air party with lots of joy and beautiful music. People are dancing and singing in the streets along with Andre Rieu and Johann Strauss Orchestra.This DVD is 16:9 in screen format with some bonus features on disc. Andre speaks in Dutch, but subtitles are available. On the Other hand audio is Dolby5.0 (please see comments below) and Dolby2.0. Soloists are Susan Erens, Carla Maffioletti, Carmen Monarcha and The Platin Tenors. As extra features it has a 25 minutes TV special by local tv and three extra tracks namely My Father's Favorite, Halleluja, Milord. Also there is a 2 minutes rapid motion video showing preparations for the concert.I strongly recommend this DVD to all fans and starters of this genre. You will have great joy and you will find yourself watching this DVD over and over again. Also I can recommend this DVD as a gift for your friends and loved-ones, you won't be disappointed and (believe me) they will adore your choice...
summary: Do NOT pass without placing an order!...

reviewText: This is the best piece of entertainment i have ever experienced. We had an oldies cocktail party and concert that went on into the early hours, a rare thing i can tell you. It was so popular that we watched "Tuscany" as well; by popular demand. Many new fans were created and we are now all planning to go in a group down to the concert in Brisbane. Just loved it.However there is a down side to everything, i bought the same DVD again under a different title; "Songs from my heart" or similar and we have noticed there is a fair amount of this around. And thats not good.Rgds Iandor

reviewText: This is my all-time favorite Andre Rieu concert DVD.  He is a 'home town hero' in Maastricht and it really is moving to see how he loves the city and his neighbors love him.  On our travels we have actually been in this square, now magically transformed for a live concert by an impressive stage set.  Many members of his orchestra are also from the area.  For all of them, this is a special homecoming and they seem enthusiastic to share their talents with a wider audience.Two absolutely magical offerings are provided by the local bell-ringer, who is also a regular member of Andre's orchestra.  His scenes of 'dashing to and from' the bell tower to perform on one segment have to be seen!  A great local voice, Benny ***, sings his great composition, 'Ode to Maastrict' and there is not a dry eye in the place.  His performance is a 'shiver-making moment' seldom equaled on DVD.  Once again, Rieu offers the 'Radetzky March', an ever-popular signature piece on several of his other DVDs.  Other works presented are less often heard but are long-time favorites in the classical music world or in Broadway music theater.  The production values are 'first class' and the whole experience makes one feel like one was present during a magical evening.The 'extras' on the DVD are eye-opening in revealing the multitude of steps it takes to put on a show like this and to record it for DVD.If you are only buying one Rieu DVD, this should be it.  But why stop there?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was the first Andre Rieu concert I saw, and it was a lucky fluke. You definitely get a richer experience with the visual element. I now have various other Rieu concert DVDs, but this is the only one I incessantly re-watch. The price (for used *or* new) isn't bad since it has over 2.5 hours of content. It has cute special features, but they don't overpower the concert.I'm going to stay out of the "classical or Pops" debate that has long raged about Rieu, his conducting style, and the Johann Strauss Orchestra. Simply put, this is a thoroughly enjoyable program! The music in this concert has a less contrived theme than some other Rieu concerts out there - and although still a bit random (example: "Memory" comes right after a mischievous minor-key Slavic song), the mix leaves your musical stomach feeling full by the end. There are some lovely but relatively obscure soloist singers, but the concert doesn't get weighed down by irritatingly perky German folksongs or maudlin opera excerpts (I love my operas, but they can easily be out of place in an energetic open-air concert). The instrumentals are nice, alternating between thoughtful/contemplative and riotous. Rieu frequently gets chatty about the songs (which somehow comes off being corny and earthy at the same time), and although he only speaks Dutch in this program, fear not! There are many well-placed subtitles for the English speakers.Interspersed among the songs are some clever but low-tech stunts (ballroom dancers on stage, an amusing section with a carillon player, etc.).Deadly serious classical buffs won't like this kind of concert. For those who like variety but hate variety TV shows, this might be a good choice. It's also very tame but slightly sophisticated background noise for a family gathering.
summary: This is a fun one! Probably one of the best introductions for new Rieu listeners/viewers

reviewText: The best Andre Rieu DVD ever but the sound quality is misleading, it is not Dolby 5.1 (6 channel) - the DVD features Dolby 5.0 (5 channel) sound. That means if you have a Dolby Digital Home Theater System there is no bass at all. I don't know why they would master such a DVD with no bass???

reviewText: Not certain..but i believe Andre's latest DVD "Songs from my Heart" that I purchased from his website is "Homecoming" (USA)version. Every time he puts out a DVD..i keep saying..this is the best one yet..well..here we go again..there are 28 tracks on this DVD..for me..every one was enjoyable..he performed this in  his hometown Maastrich. He has 3 tenors as guest's..they are fabulous..and when they perform with Andre's 3 sopranos..unbeatable..when Carmen does "Song of Vilja"..your heart will melt..for all the Andre fans..this DVD is a must for your collection..I hope the USA company putting out "Homecoming" has improved in quality..seems in the past they have not been up to par with the European versions.
